net.akaish.kitty.orm

Class KittyDatabase<M extends KittyModel>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.akaish.kitty.orm.KittyDatabase<M>

  • public abstract class KittyDatabase<M extends KittyModel>
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class to be used with KittyKitty sqlite Child must be annotated with KITTY_DATABASE annotation. Also it can be annotated with KITTY_DATABASE_HELPER annotation.
    Author:
    akaish (Denis Bogomolov)

      • KittyDatabase

        See KittyDatabase(Context, String) for more info.
        Parameters:
        ctx -

      • KittyDatabase

        protected KittyDatabase(android.content.Context ctx,
                        java.lang.String databasePassword)
        KittyORM main database class that represents bootstrap and holder for all related with database components.
        What happens here?
        1) Setting database password if not null. (!) Database encryption not implemented in basic KittyORM KittyDatabaseHelper, so, you have to implement it yourself.
        2) Call of getStaticRegistry(). his method is not implemented here, you have to implement it yourself. It just sets registry storage to null, so it can be filled via reflection at database configuration routine. But it is expensive operation and after designing your database it would be good point to optimise it and create registry storage manually via overriding getStaticRegistry().
        3) Call of getStaticModelMapperInstancesStorage(). This method is not implemented here, you have to implement it yourself. It just sets Model-Mapper storage to null, so it can be filled via reflection with generateMMInstanceStorageFromRegistry(Map, KittyMMEntryFactory, KittyDatabaseConfiguration). But it is expensive operation and after designing your database it would be good point to optimise it and create model mapper instance storage manually via overriding getStaticModelMapperInstancesStorage().
        4) Setting KittyDatabaseConfiguration from getConfigurator(Context, Map). If you want to use your own configurator than you should override getConfigurator(Context, Map) in your implementation to use your own implementation of KittyConfigurator.
        5) Setting helper configuration with getDBHelperConfiguration(). You can also override it for your personal purposes if necessary.
        6) Setting model mapper entry factory. This factory would be used for creating instances of model\mapper via reflection for autogenerated mm instance storage.
        7) Setting registry from database configuration that was generated before. Would be called only if getStaticRegistry() returned null before.
        8) Setting model\mapper instance storage with generateMMInstanceStorageFromRegistry(Map, KittyMMEntryFactory, KittyDatabaseConfiguration). Would be called only if getStaticModelMapperInstancesStorage() returned null before;
        9) Setting new database helper with newDatabaseHelper(). If you want to use your own implementation of KittyDatabaseHelper, for example, for implementing database encryption, override newDatabaseHelper().
        10) Setting predefined creation script to helper via getPreGeneratedCreateStatements(KittyDatabaseConfiguration). If you want some performance optimisation, you can override it to use static collection of create schema statements sequence.
        11) Setting predefined drop script to helper via getPreGeneratedDropStatements(KittyDatabaseConfiguration). If you want some performance optimisation, you can override it to use static collection of drop schema statements sequence.
        Parameters:
        ctx - Anroid context, not null.
        databasePassword - database password, note that you have to use your own implementation of KittyDatabaseHelper that supports database encryption as well as you have to override newDatabaseHelper() to pass it into KittyDatabase implementation.

    • Method Detail

      • getConfigurator

        protected KittyConfigurator getConfigurator(android.content.Context ctx,
                                            java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<M>,java.lang.Class<KittyMapper>> registry)
        Returns KittyConfigurator to be used with this database By default would be created KittyConfiguratorADC, however you can implement any configuration storage you want.
        This method used at KittyDatabase initialization
        Parameters:
        ctx - application context
        registry - application registry
        Returns:
        KittyConfigurator

      • newDatabaseHelper

        protected KittyDatabaseHelper newDatabaseHelper()

      • getStaticModelMapperInstancesStorage

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<M>,KittyMMEntry> getStaticModelMapperInstancesStorage()
        Returns static map where keys are model's classes and entries are pairs of models and mappers instances. Not implemented here, should be implemented by developer in order to avoid generating this map with reflection.
        Having static map filled up with normally initiated mappers would speed up KittyORM quite a bit.
        Returns:

      • getStaticRegistry

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<M>,java.lang.Class<KittyMapper>> getStaticRegistry()
        Method used for getting static registry of mappers. Not implemented here, should be implemented by developer in order to avoid generating registry with reflection.
        Having static registry filled up with normally initiated mappers would speed up KittyORM quite a bit.
        Returns:
        static registry of mappers, where keys are model classes.

      • getPreGeneratedCreateStatements

        protected java.util.LinkedList<KittySQLiteQuery> getPreGeneratedCreateStatements(KittyDatabaseConfiguration dbConf)
        By implementing this vias static collection of queries you would speed up KittyORM initialization.
        Also
        Be sure that create statements that would be returned by this method would not have schema name before table name cause for some reason on some (maybe most or all) Androids you for some reason would receive unknown database SQLite error at schema generation. E.g. use CREATE TABLE table_name instead of CREATE TABLE database_name.table_name here.
        Parameters:
        dbConf -
        Returns:

        This method has higher priority than script that may be returned from any stored script

        public void printPregeneratedDropSchemaToLog(java.lang.String logTag)

      • getPreGeneratedDropStatements

        protected java.util.LinkedList<KittySQLiteQuery> getPreGeneratedDropStatements(KittyDatabaseConfiguration dbConf)
        By implementing this via static collection of queries you would speed up KittyORM initialization.
        Also
        Be sure to implement it with such drop statements order to avoid FK constraints, cause there is no way to avoid it without overcomplicated queries.
        And be sure that all tables in drop sequence starts with table name, i.e. Drop table SOMEDB.sometable;
        Parameters:
        dbConf -
        Returns:

      • log

        protected java.lang.String log(KittyLog.LOG_LEVEL level,
                               java.lang.String message,
                               boolean useDefaultFormatter,
                               java.lang.Throwable tr)
        Simple method for logging in this db class if log is on. Returns message parameter if no formatting should be used or formatted string where:
        {0} is value for Object.getClass() canonical name
        {1} is value for KittyDBHelperConfiguration.schemaName
        {2} is value for KittyDBHelperConfiguration.schemaVersion
        {4} is value for KittyDatabaseHelper used with this bootstrap class.
        TODO: I know that is the same method with just different formatter option as used in KittyDatabaseHelper, so I would rewrite it without CP (copy-paste, lol) in future.
        Parameters:
        level -
        message -
        useDefaultFormatter -
        tr - any throwable, may be null
        Returns:
